info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 3:49PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN SCHUYLKILL AND SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIA COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM EST... At 348 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Carmel, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Tamaqua, Shenandoah, Mahanoy City, Mcadoo, Hometown, Tuscarora, Oneida, Grier City-Park Crest, Delano, Nuremburg, Aristes, Numidia, Sheppton, Brandonville, Coaldale, Slabtown, Locust Lake State Park, New Boston-Morea, Shumans and Snyders. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
